intro: Dimerostemma scabrosum, commonly known as the rough dimerostemma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Dimerostemma scabrosum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
